page.title: 14THe Knepp Estate, Shipley.3.
page.content: {Changing Times - The Future?} Knepp Estate including seven tenanted farms holds to a policy of retaining hedges and has resisted modern pressures to enlarge fields for more efficient use of machinery and manpower. It is based on drainage, variety of soil types, conservation and hunting.In recent years reductions in employees and amalgamation of farms have reduced the need for tied cottage and farmhouse accomodation. Some have been sold. Following the recent death of Sir Walter Burrell in 1985 and changes in taxation laws there are bound to be reconsiderations of farming and management policies on the Knepp Estate.
